title: COVID-19 Ethiopia -Health Worker Training Platform
description: Background COVID-19 Ethiopia is a health worker learning/training platform supported by the Community Health Academy-Last Mile Health using the OppiaMobile app technology. Objective To reach health workers with appropriate, up-to-date and multimedia aided COVID-19 information and training content on mobile devices accessed anywhere, anytime. One of the major limiting factors to a timely COVID-19 response is the need for social distancing which prevents traditional capacity building efforts such as face-to-face training. COVID-19 Ethiopia training platform has been developed to address this need in a timely manner. What is it? OppiaMobile is an open source mobile learning platform specially designed for delivering learning content such as multimedia and quizzes in low-resource settings. Course content can be developed in Moodle and then exported to run offline on the OppiaMobile Android app. Who is the Target Audience? Frontline health workers including; nurses, health officers, physicians, volunteers working in health facilities and other health service delivery points set up for COVID-19 across all 11 regions of Ethiopia. How Does It Work? Once COVID-19 Ethiopia is downloaded onto a smart phone or tablet, the training content is readily available for use offline. Users earn points for engagement with the course content, and badges when they complete a course. When a course is updated, users are automatically notified that a new version is available, so they can keep their course content up-to-date. Rollout •	FMOH, EPHI and Community Health Academy will jointly launch the training platform and upload on google Playstore. •	FMOH/EPHI COVID-19 response teams will endorse, approve uploading of training content and protocols on the platform. •	Frontline health workers, program managers and all public health professionals will be encouraged to download app and access up-to-date and FMOH approved COVID-19 content. •	The training platform/app has already been uploaded on 500 tablets to be distributed by FMOH free of charge to COVID-19 response team members. Courses and materials to be offered on COVID-19-Ethiopia platform •	Surveillance •	Case Management •	Laboratory •	Infection Prevention and Control •	Risk Communication and Community Engagement •	COVID-19 handbook for Health Workers How to Access COVID-19 Ethiopia Training App Users can download the COVID-19 Ethiopia Training App from the Google Playstore. The App requires minimal storage space at less than 5 MB.
